text: The Independent Social Alliance Movement () is a progressive indigenist party in Colombia. At the last legislative elections, 10 March 2002, the party won parliamentary representation, one of many smaller parties. ==History== On December 2, 2005, the movement announced its support for Antanas Mockus in the 2006 presidential campaign. In the election of 2006, the party won two (out of a hundred) senatorial seats. ==External links== * Etnias de Colombia: Indigenous Social Alliance Movement Category:Indigenist political parties in South America Category:Political parties in Colombia Category:Progressive parties in Colombia
title: Indigenous Social Alliance Movement
